intro: Trollius uralensis, commonly known as the Ural globeflower, is a herbaceous perennial native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its showy, bright yellow, globe-shaped flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features basal leaves that are palmately lobed. It thrives in well-drained, loamy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Trollius uralensis is valued in horticulture for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in gardens for its vibrant floral display.
